ovdesc.p: This ‘H’ table contains the list of BIC codes in 8 or 11 characters that will be used as enrichment by the SEPA application tables. If one refers to a code BIC that is not present in that table, an override message will be posted during the validation process of both SEPA.FOLLOW.UP and FT.
The automatic initial and periodic takeover from any available source should be easy to realize.

The use of that table is only made through the routine given in the BIC.ENRICHEMENT.RTN field of the SEPA.PARAMETER system table. By default, the delivered one is @SEPA.BANK.ENRICH. But if the bank prefers to use any other T24 standard or local table, it is quite easy: a new routine is to be created on the same model to access that table instead of SEPA.BANK (that may stay unused) and its name should replace the default one in the parameter table

desc.p: This field holds the Flag value for SCT
This field holds the Flag value for SDD
This field specifies the Start date of SEPA.BANK record
This field specifies the End date of SEPA.BANK record
This field defines the Address and this Field is an Optional Input Field
This field is specified with a Valid Bank name
This field holds a valid BIC key
Value range from 8 to 11 type A(Alphanumeric)
This Field holds the Optional enrichment for other agent.
This Field specifies the File name in which the file gets stored in the path specified for routing directory
This field holds the Value for routing B2B
This field holds the Value for routing SCT
This field holds the Value for routing SDD
This field holds the Flag value for SDD-B2B
This field holds the value 'SCT', SDD CORE' or 'SDDB2B'
This field holds the Version of Rulebook of the product that is supported
Associated Multi Value set of Field PRODUCT
This field holds the status of the record
The latest time by which, payments/collections for this product can be remitted to Sepa Clearer for same day settlements
Associated Multi Value set of Field PRODUCT
This field holds the Admission Profile. Allowed values are provided below
CAD(The Bank is both Debtor and Creditor Agent and can send AND receive Direct Debit)
CRD(The Bank is a Creditor Agent only and can only send Direct Debit. The creditor bank should never be able to receive a Payment Cancellation Request or Reversal)
DEB(The Bank is a Debtor Agent only and can only receive Direct Debit. The debtor bank should never be able to receive a Refund/Return or a Reject/Refusal)
This fields holds the direct participant BIC
The field holds the payment type allowed for AOS participant
